TopicTitle: What's the oddest test rig you ever built?

Articles.Content:
We all know part testing contracts can be quite odd. From testing basic jets splashed down (wouldn't water cause an intake malfunction?) to using an LV-909 as the first stage, the auto-generator definitely thinks up some weird stuff. I was presented with the aforementioned testing contracts and, having no real survey ability yet as an alternative, decided to take them on. At the same time. Here's the bizzare rig I ended up building:

![xkdvjm.png](http://a.pomf.se/xkdvjm.png)

What's the most bizarre contraption you've had to build to meet the conditions of a test?
